AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%MSG
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
%%$DATE %%TIME - The request to execute the Asset Depreciation Batch Job has been received, but has been placed on hold. Please review the KFS parameter DEPRECIATION_RUN_DATE found within the KFS-CAM namespace to ensure it is set appropriately for the job to run as desired.

After the parameter has been reviewed and the adjustment has been completely approved, as necessary, please contact the KFS technical support team for the Asset Depreciation Batch Job to be released for execution. If the tech team does not receive notification today to release the job for processing, the nightly batch processing will be held up until that event occurs.

Parameter Location:
Administration Tab --> Configuration Section --> Functional Heading --> Parameter Hyperlink
Select KFS-CAM in the Namespace Code field before performing the 'Search'

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%MSG
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
%%$DATE %%TIME - The CFDA update process has been completed.

Any existing CFDA values that were in the system prior to the execution of the process would not have been automatically updated due to the manual setting that is in place. Although, as a reminder, there may have been new CFDA values added to the system as a result of the process. These new values must have the maintenance type flag set to MANUAL in the system or the next time the process is ran, the process will automatically update these values.

Reminder:

CFDA values can be found in the following location in KFS:

Maintenance Tab --> Contracts & Grants --> CFDA

ON.CODE: *Time Limit for file watching was exceeded*

DOMAIL.MESSAGE: 0349ControlM did not find a current check file on the server for today. The check file is produced by performing the online Format Checks/ACH process. If a check file is not found by the end time established in ControlM, this email will be generated and the remainder of the batch processing defined within the 'Format' schedule will not be completed.00000266Even if there are no checks to format or print for any particular day, the online function must be completed to produce the empty check file, which will trigger the remaining processes to be completed. These processes include the ACH and eCustom file transmissions.00000606If this was in error and someone forgot to perform the online function in time to avoid this notification, then the online function can be completed at this time, but a notification must occur to the KFS technical support team to have the 'Format' schedule re-ran manually for the day. If the 'Format' check process is not ran on the day that the check file is created, the file will not be sent to Bottom Line. Otherwise, you may wait until the following day and complete the online process prior to the schedule end time to avoid this notification again and all processes will be completed accordingly.00000019Job name: %%JOBNAME0017Table: %%SCHEDTAB0024Run date %%$ODATE %%TIME0027Number of tries: %%RUNCOUNT
DOMAIL.SUBJECT: (STG) STG FAILURE: KFS-FMT-CHKXCF - No Bottom Line Check file found

DOMAIL.SUBJECT: (STG) Remedy ticket alert

After the parms have been reviewed and approved, please contact the KFS technical support team for the job to be released.

Procurement & Contracting Services Reminder: AFTER this job has been approved by Financial Services and run by KFS technical support, update the parameter value for ALLOW_ENCUMBER_NEXT_YEAR_DAYS to open up Requisitions to the next fiscal year.

----

JOB.AUTHOR: REDACTED
JOB.CMDLINE: if [ "%%ENV" = "PRD" ]; then u=%%USER;dcw=%%DOCUWARE;base="%%BASE_DIR";dirs="%%ARCHIVE_DIRS";ran="%%DOCUWARE_RUN";if [ ! -e $ran ]; then touch -t 201101010000 $ran;fi;err=0;for d in $dirs;do find "$base/$d" -type f -newer $ran -not -empty -exec lftp -c "open -u $u, sftp://$dcw ; put ""'{}'""" \; ;e=$?;find "$base/$d" -type f -newer $ran -empty -exec ~/bin/dspace.sh '{}' $u $dcw \; ;if [ "$?" -ne "0" -o "$e" -ne "0" ]; then echo $d: failed;err=1;fi;done;if [ "$err" -eq "0" ]; then touch $ran;fi;fi
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Archives the KFS reports, staging, and archive folders to Docuware at FSO

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%MSG
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
%%$DATE %%TIME 
Attached are reports results associated with monthly PRJE batch process.

As a reminder, this should be the final processing item for the prior accounting period. Once confirmed, please inactivate the prior accounting period, which would prevent prior period accounting entries from posting. If any entry for prior period occurs after the inactivation, errors would be reported on the scrubber error report.

Reminder:
Accounting Periods may be found in the following location in KFS:
Maintenance Tab --> Chart Of Accounts Section --> Accounting Period Hyperlink

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%CC_FSO_KFS_REPORTS_PAYROLL
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE: -c kfsbsateam@list.arizona.edu

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%MSG
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
%%$DATE %%TIME - The monthly pro-rate journal entry process is ready to be ran, but has been placed on hold for parameter review.

After the parameters have been reviewed and adjustments completed, as necessary, please contact the KFS technical support team for the schedule (Monthly PRJE) to be released for execution.

If notification is not received today to release the jobs for processing, the nightly batch processing will be held up until that event occurs.

Reminder:

Parameters can be found in the following location in KFS:

Administration Tab --> Configuration Section --> Functional Heading --> Parameter Hyperlink
Select KUALI-PRJE in the Namespace Code field before performing the 'Search'

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%SUBJ
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE: Review and Confirm Monthly PRJE Parameters - FP Team Review

JOB.AUTHOR: REDACTED
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Notifys kfsdevelopers that the weekday nightly batch processing has completed successfully.

DOMAIL.MESSAGE: 0107The financial processing portion of the (%%ENV) nightly batch for today, %%$DATE, has completed at %%TIME.00000071That means that the following jobs streams have all finished executing:0019Archibus Processing0023Core Accounting Segment0024PCard Processing Segment0032eInvoice and SciQuest processing0035Bank Transaction Processing Segment00000298If any special schedules, such as Month End or Annual processing ran, those were not explicity accounted for in this email, but if they failed to compelete then one of the above segments would not have completed, and you would not have received this email. So, this implies that they too completed.00000294The overall nightly batch should still be checked. Some jobs are designed to continue, even upon a KFS batch job failure status. However, by receiving this email it does imply that the Nightly Batch did fully execute and that no criical jobs have failed (those that do not continue on failure).00000248Following this email, there are some Control-M jobs remaining, including system cleanup jobs and those jobs that restore user access. Once you receve an email that user access has been restored, the Nightly Batch for this evening is fully complete.00000015---------------0014%%$DATE.%%TIME0009%%JOBNAME

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%MSG
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
Attached are the additional reports that provide the results associated with the batch processing for the labor ledger after the execution of the ERE Budget sweep job. These reports will provide information on the condition of the labor ledger balances, along with a report that provides the summary data that will feed to the GL.

This data will be further processed with the remainder of the generated ledger transactions from other internal and external areas and ultimately be found within the entries and balances that make up the general ledger.

Sent: %%$DATE %%TIME

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%CC_FSO_KFS_REPORTS_FIN_MGMT
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE: -c kfsbsateam@list.arizona.edu

JOB.AUTHOR: REDACTED
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Bottomline http upload script

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%BTTMLN
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
echo -e '#/bin/bash
u=$1
p=$2
url=$3
shift
shift
shift
for f in `dir $1`
do
x=`php -f $HOME/bin/urlencode.php<$f`
if [ "$3" != "PRD" ]; then
ca="--cacert $HOME/sslcerts/devfso-cert.pem"
fi
echo -n "xml=$x"|curl $ca -d "userid=$u" -d "pass=$p" -d "@-" $url
if [ "$?" -ne "0" ]; then
echo -e "$6: $f"|mutt -s "\050$3\051 FAILURE: $4 - $7" $5
else
echo -e "$8: $f"|mutt -s "\050$3\051 SUCCESS: $4 - $9" $5
mv $f $2
fi
done'>$HOME/bin/kfsbl.sh;chmod u+x $HOME/bin/kfsbl.sh;cat $HOME/bin/kfsbl.sh

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%DOCUWARE
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
echo -e '#/bin/bash
f=`ls -1 "$1" | tr '''\n'' ''\0''' | xargs -0 -n 1 basename`
u=$2
dcw_host=$3
echo -n " " >"/tmp/$f"
lftp -c '"open -u '$u, sftp://$dcw_host ; put ''/tmp/\$f'">$HOME/bin/dspace.sh;chmod u+x $HOME/bin/dspace.sh;cat $HOME/bin/dspace.sh

JOB.AUTHOR: REDACTED
JOB.DESCRIPTION: JPMC cardholder script

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%PCDH
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
echo -e '#/bin/bash
r=`echo $1|tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]'`
s=`echo $2|sed "s/ENV/$r/"`
x=$3
t=$4
cd $s/outgoing
n=`ls $t|wc -l`
if [ "$n" -eq "0" ]; then
cd ../incoming
n=`ls $t|wc -l`
if [ "$n" -ne "0" ]; then
w=`grep -s "^ 20" $t|wc -l`
cd ../outgoing
z=`grep -s "<cardHolder>" $x|wc -l`
if [ "$w" -eq "$z" ]; then
m="PCDH files:\n"
cd ../incoming
for c in `ls $t`
do m="$m`du -h $c` - `grep -s "^ 20" $c|wc -l` cardholders \n"
done
cd ../outgoing
m="$m\nXML files: `ls $x|wc -l`\n"
m="${m}Transformed cardholders: $z"
echo -e "$m"|mutt -s "\050$1\051 $5 - $6" $7
echo finished
else echo working
fi
else echo finished
fi
else echo working
fi
exit 0'>$HOME/bin/kfspcdh.sh;chmod u+x $HOME/bin/kfspcdh.sh;cat $HOME/bin/kfspcdh.sh

JOB.AUTHOR: REDACTED
JOB.DESCRIPTION: JPMC transactions script

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%PCDO
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
echo -e '#/bin/bash
r=`echo $1|tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]'`
s=`echo $2|sed "s/ENV/$r/"`
x=$3
t=$4
cd $s/outgoing
n=`ls $t|wc -l`
if [ "$n" -eq "0" ]; then
cd ../incoming
n=`ls $t|wc -l`
if [ "$n" -ne "0" ]; then
w=`grep -s "^ 30" $t|wc -l`
cd ../outgoing
z=`grep -s "<transaction>" $x|wc -l`
if [ "$w" -eq "$z" ]; then
m="PCDO Files:\n"
cd ../incoming
for c in `ls $t`
do m="$m`du -h $c` - `grep -s "^ 30" $c|wc -l` transactions\n"
done
cd ../outgoing
m="$m\nXML files: `ls $x|wc -l`\n"
m="${m}Transformed transactions: $z"
echo -e "$m"|mutt -s "\050$1\051 $5 - $6" $7
echo finished
else echo working
fi
else echo finished
fi
else echo working
fi
exit 0'>$HOME/bin/kfspcdo.sh;chmod u+x $HOME/bin/kfspcdo.sh;cat $HOME/bin/kfspcdo.sh

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%SUBJ
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE: Review and Confirm Annual 1099 Extract Parameters - AP Team Review

AUTOEDIT2.NAME: %%MSG
AUTOEDIT2.VALUE:
The first execution of the 1099 payee extract process for the new year is ready to be ran, but has been placed on hold. Please review the KFS parameters to ensure they are set appropriately.

After the parameters have been reviewed and adjustments completely approved, as necessary, please contact the KFS technical support team for the payee extract schedule (1099 Tax) to be released for execution. If the tech team does not receive notification today to release the jobs for processing, the nightly batch processing will be held up until that event occurs.

Reminder:

Parameters can be found in KFS:

Administration Tab --> Parameter Hyperlink
Select KUALI-TAX in the Namespace Code field before performing the 'Search'
----
 %%DATE %%TIME
